overview: This measure has been amended to incorporate two new claims that were resolved after the bill was last amended, bringing the total number of claims to twenty-three. The Department of the Attorney General's testimony requests increasing the total appropriation to $6,569,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_). A Senate committee report also indicates the bill's effective date has been changed to April 23, 2057 (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_), to facilitate further discussion on the measure.
appropriations: The Department of the Attorney General's testimony requests the addition of two claims totaling $70,514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_), which includes $70,000.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_) for the Lisa Ann Daguro v. State of Hawaii settlement and a miscellaneous claim of $514.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_). A committee hearing determines these funds should be added (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_), which increases the requested appropriation from the general fund to $5,229,381.07 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_). The appropriation from departmental funds remains unchanged at $1,340,000.00 (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_).
policy_impact: The measure has been amended to change the effective date to April 23, 2057 (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_), a notable change from the previous version, to allow for further discussion. Additionally, amendments were made to correct the descriptions for the Billy Peter v. Anne E. Lopez and Child Evangelism Fellowship of Hawaii, Inc. v. Hawaii State Department of Education claims from 'Settlement' to 'Judgment' (HB990_SD1_SSCR1165_). This ensures the legal accuracy of the bill's provisions based on testimony from the Department of the Attorney General (HB990_HD2_TESTIMONY_JDC_03-13-25_).
